snippet: China’s unusually calm reply to the Obama administration’s complaint to the World Trade Organization about the tariffs puzzled trade analysts.
abstract: Chinese government issues an uncommonly mild response to a United States trade complaint challenging China’s imposition of steep tariffs on American-made sport utility vehicles and midsize and large cars; measured tone reflects China's desire to avoid making trade issues a big theme in the American presidential election campaign.
lead_paragraph: China’s unusually calm reply to the Obama administration’s complaint to the World Trade Organization about the tariffs puzzled trade analysts.

headline.main: China Yawns as U.S. Complains About Auto Tariffs
headline.print_headline: China Yawns as U.S. Complains About Auto Tariffs
